isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-6613 SERIES - AIR SYSTEM - INTERMEDIATE SHIFT CYLINDER AND COVER ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: INTERMEDIATE SHIFT CYLINDER AND COVER ASSEMBLY

svcsubproc.title: Troubleshooting Cover Assembly

figure.caption: Figure 7. Intermediate Shift Cylinder Cover Assembly

step1.para: Exhaust Port - Any constant flow of air out the cover exhaust port usually indicates a faulty insert valve. Exhaust should occur briefly ONLY when the selector valve button is moved from "low" to "intermediate."
Insert Valve - A faulty insert valve, leaking at the outer diameter O-rings or inner seals will result in failure to shift. Two indications of O-ring or seal failures are:

step2.para: Constant leak out the cover exhaust.
Constant leak out the selector valve exhaust port "E" (refer to Description) with the selector valve button in "low" (providing a selector valve is operating properly).

svcsubproc.para: The three O-rings on the outer diameter of the insert valve can be replaced. If an inner seal is damaged, the entire insert valve will have to be replaced.

svcsubproc.title: Troubleshooting Cylinder

figure.caption: Figure 8. Cross Section of Auxiliary Shift Cylinder Assembly

svcsubproc.para: There are two O-ring seals in the intermediate shift cylinder.

step1.para: Leak at seal A - Possible failure to shift or slow shift to intermediate or direct plus pressurizing of transmission
Leak at seal B - Slow range shift between low and intermediate plus leak out the cover exhaust when in intermediate or direct.
